reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the hotel during our holiday in June 2013. It was really a nice stay! We stayed at the family room, very spacious with 2 king-size beds. The bathroom was clean and roomy. In general the hotel was very clean and was modern in design.
reviews.title: An unforgettable stay

reviews.text: The hotel was located in Bukit Bintang area, only about 10-min walk to department stores and Alor street, where you can find a lot of food hawker in very reasonable price. Also about 10-min walk, you can reach Pudu Sentral bus station, if you'd like to go to Genting or Malacca. About 20-min walk you can find Petaling Street, the Chinatown area.
reviews.title: Cheap, good and clean budget hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and i really enjoyed our stay here for two nights. Big, comfy bed. Aircon was working well. Nice pillows. Hotel is right in the centre of anywhere i wish to go such as BB, BTS and bus station. There is also a nice indian restaurant next to the hospital serving cheap and good food. The downside is, hotel receptionists are unwelcoming. Especially this fat chinese lady who told me that i have to follow up on my ironing board request. I requested for it on day 2 of my stay, it didn't came. So upon checking out, i told the lady and that was the reply i got. I just politely informed her about the ironing board but she sounded sarcastic as if i must follow up again because the staff must have forgotten because they have alot of things to do. Your staff forgots guest's requests. So is that the guest's problem?! No apology made. Gave us a stucked face. I wasn't complaining. I am just letting you know. That's all. Same goes to the hotel staff by the name of Zamri, if i'm not mistaken. Please educate your staff to smile more and be polite. The ironic thing is that the security guards are way more helpful, showing us the directions and friendly. Overall bad service. Good hotel. Clean and huge rooms. Strategic location. Wifi connection sucks.
reviews.title: Very Good 3 stars

reviews.text: Stayed in Sky Express on 21st June for 3days 2nights at room 8012.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Room is big and was facing the main road but peaceful enough during the night. Shower was very powerful and 'HOT' (can have steam bath if you want to),air-con very powerful too. Strong wifi in the room,TV channel only have 6 local & 3 cable, breakfast is average if you are looking for fast break. Just like all tripadvisors mentioned it is VERY EASY to access Bukit Bintang or further from this hotel.
reviews.title: A BIT OVER THE BASIC

reviews.text: Hotels located at the convenient place. Get off yr train at Imbi station would make it fast to access the hotel. And when u turn right of the hotel , go straight then turn right again. U will arrive the Jalan Alor street for overnight dining! Hotel rooms is great, clean with wifi access and comfortable bed. But staff were not so helpful, when we ask for the beer opener, they just said they don't hv.....?! Such a big hotel even don't hv a beer opener? When asking for the location , staff just said they don't know. So when u asking for direction to somewhere, better not seek help from staff.
reviews.title: Good location but poor staff

reviews.text: I spent 2 days in Kuala Lumpur. First night I stayed at Sky Express. I paid the promotional price of RM148 for a double room without windows. Everything is superb except that the reception of my cell phone was intermittent inside the room. However, I could access to its Wifi really fast. The staff were courteous except one female receptionist who was sulky most of the time.
reviews.title: My experience with 2 hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I moved to the MyHotel@Bukit Bintang (just 2 doors away) the next day and I regretted my move immediately. The hotel was run down and the lounge was very noisy. My windowless room had no access to Wifi of its hotel, though I had no problem at all accessing the Wifi of its neighbour, the Sky Express. The room is very much smaller and poorly furnished. The room rates of both hotel are almost the same. I'll stick to Sky Express in the future.
reviews.title: Nice place in a good location

reviews.text: The hotel is right behind the corner from the food street - Jalan Alor - and pretty close to many malls and to a couple of LRT stations. It is also a walking distance to KLCC. The room was clean and decent-sized, with comfortable beds, good ac and shower, a small fridge, a large tv, a safe and working free wi-fi. It even had a view - you could see the top of the Petronas twin towers from the window. The one thing I didn't like was that they took a deposit for the keys, which leaves you with 50 ringgit upon departure.
reviews.title: Conveniently located in Bukit bintang

reviews.text: Stay with group of friends from the 25th-27th Jan at the hotel. Location is superb as its conveniently located close to Bukit Bintang & China town(10 Minute walk) however its locations keeps u out of the rushing shoppers , trafic and the noise of thees areas. Jalan Alore is just behind the hotel if u are there for the food....
reviews.title: Good centrally located hotel!

reviews.text: For 158ringit its great value. try to get a room with an opening window. There are some rooms without a window at all, i personally found it a bit claustraphobic and its probably not good in a fire.
reviews.title: Great value-the details

reviews.text: Great value otherwise, its a new building and otherwise well designed. They provided us with water, security locker (barely big enough for a 15" laptop. small refrigerator (that doesnt have minibar which i really like), hairdryer, excellent water pressure and warm shower, large and new tv (local stations only- (with this size tv they might think about providing cable), excellent matress clean bed and room. towels, great lighting options. key cards with out the massive penalty if you loose them. good location, its not soundproofed but its not too loud anyway. Good location in Bukit bintang- close to central markets the street stalls go on till 10 or 11pm.
reviews.title: Best Value of Money in Bukit Bintang

reviews.text: Good for a shopping trip and to see the petronas tower.
reviews.title: Cheap. Good location. Good for an overnight stay in KL.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception- there are a couple of reception staff that do not appear to be professionally trained, mainly picked up in their attitude. Seems like they are working to improve this however. The gym is a treadmill and cross trainer in a small room. The wifi is a little unstable but fast when its going. its a 20-30ringit (you can pay them in advance) taxi ride to sentral station- to the express train to the airport(28minutes) express train operators are there at 6am- the ticket machine was not operating.
reviews.title: Average hotel indeed!

reviews.text: I stayed here last month on 11 - 18, got this hotel by accident, since I have troubled during my arrival and didn't get the hotel that I wanted, I choose this one instead. First impression for this hotel, they have a great location, not really in the hustle bustle area in bukit bintang, but it's only 10 minutes walking to BB Plaza, Sungei Wang and Pavilion, it's perfect, and it's also close to Alor street too! where you can eat hawkers food (mostly chinese food, not halal)
reviews.title: good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a flight stop over in KL and spent a night at this hotel. It is quite reasonable for a lower priced hotel and convenient to good street restaurants and shopping. The breakfast is not expensive but a bit average and those seeking a more westerner style breakfast may be better off finding something outside the hotel unless breakfast is included in the room price. My main concern with the hotel is that after paying the bill we went to order a taxi to the airport and the hotel's transport person in the lobby said he would take us for the same price as a taxi. 90RM was clearly agreed and that is the price we had been quoted by taxis. When we got to the airport he put the squeeze on and charged us 98RM and kept the doors of the car locked until we paid. Only 8RM difference, but I was not impressed with the attitude of this employee. Other staff were polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Australian traveller
Very comfortable
reviews.text: Sky Express is a fairly new hotel and only a few minutes walk to the main shopping strip and just around the corner from Jalan Alor - eat street - where restaurants and food stalls line both sides of the street. It's a 10 minute taxi ride to Sentral for buses and trains and the KLIA Express. The room was big with a very comfortable king size bed, a good bathroom and great air conditioning. There is a money changer and 7eleven next door. We returned to the hotel three weeks later when back in KL for our flight back to Australia.

i spent my last night in KL with staying in this hotel.the location is good if you want to go to the Chinatown (Jalan Petaling Jaya) but i dont have much time to go there. the recepcionist said that we can go to Bukit Baintang Malls Area by walk, it takes only like 10 mins. so i go through the street to reach Bukit Bintang Malls Area. but we had like 20 mins to walk until we saw some malls in that area. i dont really remember the name. because i wanna go to LOT 10, which they have H&M.. in the night, we can go to the famous street food stalls in JALAN ALOR.. we just need like 5 mins, it just really close to this hotel.. at night, i got a super good slept with comfort bedroom :) lovely! and last but bot least, the price is really affordable for what you can get.. the bathroom is spacious
reviews.title: comfortable yet affordable

reviews.text: I do not agree with Bob123 (I wish your experience had been as good as ours) as we did not have the same experience at all.
reviews.title: Good Value With All The Basics; Also Liked Location

reviews.text: We found the Sky Express Hotel to be very good 'bang for buck' (value for money); a nicely sized King Superior room with king bed, side tables, well lit, quiet working air con, wall mounted flat screen TV, dressing table and large bench space, writing table and lounge chair, full length wall mounted mirror, extra cupboards, glass walled in shower cubicle with great water pressure and hot water, toiletries, hair dryer, mini safe, 2 bottles complimentary water, tea/coffee making with tea/coffee/creamer supplied, our window opened about 6" to let in fresh air, free wifi plus 4 pc's with free internet in lobby... all in a great location and for ~AUD$50 a night! What more can one ask?
reviews.title: "Bloody Dirty, AVOID AT ALL COST"
